intro: Neocussonia moratii, commonly known as the Moratii's neocussonia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
